reviews.review_text: This game is really a worthy succesor to Pool Nation. The controls are intuitive, the visuals are very impressive, and the new modes are very welcome. Only two real problems with this game, you have to tinker a bit with the graphics to get it to run smoothly, and two which is sorta minor is that they don't list the challenges for each particular match in the pause menu like they did in the original. This is really annoying when you forget them, but it's minor. I think the worst thing the developers could have done to this game is make it free-to-play. This invites the stereotypical freeloading gamers who think they're always entitled a completely free game and review the game negatively. This is not how commerce works, so get over it! It's a great game for what it is, and ignore the majority of the negative reviews because they don't even bother to review the game itself.

This is basically just Pool Nation with better graphics and little more content. The 'free' version has nothing to it though as you need to earn cash to do pretty much anything. Being someone who loved the first Pool Nation, this is a great game, but if you're looking to ACTUALLY have this game, you should buy it. The 'free' part of it is as if you were given a game's case for free, but you had to pay to get the actual disc. All in all, this is a great game, IF you really like pool games enough. If you're not crazy intp pool and you want the same experience for cheaper, get the first Pool Nation.
